name: Join our Tulalens team!
tagline: We're looking for a Marketing/Communications Expert and a Developer.
body:
###**About Tulalens**
Today, when upper- and middle- income people have a choice to make, they often turn to Yelp, TripAdvisor, and other sites where they can share and retrieve personal experiences and reviews. This kind of crowdsourced information is powerful: it can improve decision-making and accountability.

**How can low-income people also benefit from the power of crowdsourced information?** Thatâ€™s the question we asked, and Tulalens is our answer. Tulalens connects the world's under-served communities - people without internet access - to quality health services to improve lives. We're a social enterprise based in Boston. Tula means balanced in Sanskrit. Our name reflects our aim, which is to balance the lens, or create actionable insights by listening to the needs of low-income communities.

**The opportunity is vast.** Many pregnant women we work with believe they can access only one prenatal care facility near their home. Even when they are treated poorly or forced to pay bribes, they continue going to that facility. By sharing crowdsourced data on fees, quality of the provider, wait time, bribes paid and more, women now have critical information that will allow them to make informed decisions on which of several facilities to attend.  

**It's time to expand our work.** Since launching in Oct. 2014, we have reached 600 women in need of reproductive health services across three of the largest slum areas in Hyderabad. We're on our way to building a preliminary technology platform that will allow us to scale to other geographies, demographics and services.

We're actively looking for people to fill the two roles below: 

----------------------------------------------------------------------

###**Marketing and Communications Expert**
We're looking for a volunteer with marketing and communications expertise who is eager to work at a fast-paced startup social enterprise, and is willing to volunteer 5 to 10 hours of their time a week from the end of August 2015 through at least May 2016. We're not interested in producing fluffy marketing content. We're more interested in someone who wants to produce content that is catchy because it is honest, thought-provoking and maybe even humorous at times. You'll have an opportunity to create your title, and own each of the projects we work on.

This person will be: 
* Shaping our voice and developing consistent messaging across all of our social media channels, newsletter and other forms of communications
* Helping us launch a campaign to share our work in India with supporters and potential investors
* Bringing our work to life to help us engage various audiences so that we can achieve our fundraising targets, and ultimately build a technology that will allow us to scale our work  

We're looking for someone who has: 
* A passion for our mission and deep interest in understanding the people we work with  
* Extensive previous experience in social media, email marketing and communications for a startup and/or social enterprise 
* Experience with audience segmentation and channel optimization
* A willingness to experiment 
* Experience using analytics to measure effectiveness of experiments 
* Excellent storytelling, writing and editing skills
* An interest in staying on top of the latest to ensure that our content is at the cutting edge

###**Contact Us**
If all of the above sounds like your dream job, please email Priya Iyer: priya@tulalens.org. Please scrap the normal cover letter. Instead, email us a paragraph on what excites you about this position and highlight the skills you have that make you a rockstar marketing/communications expert. Please also send your resume and one or two samples of your work that align with what we're looking for.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------    

###**Developer**
We're currently looking for a volunteer developer who: 

* Wants to help shape a better future for low-income communities
* Will lead the development of our prototype technology
* Will set our technical direction and stack (we're building in Python, but open to changing)
* Can lead and mentor other developers
* Wants to improve the quality of lives of low-income people by tapping into community expertise
* Is ready to tackle tough challenges that may not have apparent technical solutions
* Has worked and/or lived in emerging markets
* Is comfortable working with us remotely for now if not based in Boston 

**If we come across someone who's an excellent fit, this role has the potential to turn into a CTO / Co-Founder role.**

###**Contact Us**
If all of the above gets you excited, please reach out to priya@tulalens.org.
